thread.title: Alcantara, Arcilla stun Japanese
thread.title_full: Alcantara, Arcilla stun Japanese | mb.com.ph | Philippine News

author: Kristel Satumbaga
title: Alcantara, Arcilla stun Japanese
text:
by Kristel Satumbaga
October 17, 2015 Filipino wild card entries Francis Casey Alcantara and Johnny Arcilla registered a huge upset when they shocked top seed Katsuki Nagao and Hiromasa Oku of Japan, 6-2, 6-2, to capture the doubles crown in the Philippine Columbian Association (PCA)-Cebuana Lhuillier ITF Men’s Futures 2 at the PCA claycourt in Paco, Manila.
Pairing up for the first time in the ITF men’s circuit, Alcantara and Arcilla stunned their Japanese rivals with their fast game and strong returns to surprise their rivals in the $15,000 tournament.
It was the first ITF men’s doubles title for both Alcantara and Arcilla in their new partnership, although both players played for the Philippine Davis Cup team in the past.
The 54-minute match victory, which earned Alcantara and Arcilla a $930 cash purse, also eclipsed their debut partnership in last week’s leg held in Pasig City where the two reached the semis.
“Maganda lang talaga yung chemistry namin sa court. Madali lang kaming magkaintindihan,” said Arcilla, an eight-time champion in the local PCA tournament.
“This week, we made sure lang na hindi kami magla-lapse. Basta laro-laro lang. Siguro nagulat lang yung kalaban kasi mabilis kami pareho, especially sa returns,” added Alcantara, 23, who won the Australian Open junior doubles title in 2009.
Alcantara and Arcilla never dropped a set all throughout the tournament, beating Filipino Jeson Patrombon and Taiwanese Yu Cheng-Yu, 6-2, 6-2; local netters PJ Tierro and Elbert Anasta, 6-4, 6-2; and Japanese pair Soichiro Moritani and Masato Shiga, 6-1, 6-3, in the 16-pair field.
Meantime, third seed Kento Takeuchi of Japan avenged his Finals loss last week to compatriot Makoto Ochi with a 2-6, 6-0, 6-1 victory yesterday to barge into the final.
Takeuchi’s win helped him arrange a championship duel against top seed Enrique Lopez-Perez of Spain, who bested No. Arata Onozawa of Japan, 6-4, 3-6, 6-1.
